title: People Performance Partner
content:
11:FS is on a mission to change the fabric of financial services. Our Ventures practice builds challenger propositions globally, like we did for Natwest with Mettle. Our Pulse team creates a benchmarking tool used by the likes of Monzo, Starling, Natwest and Tesco Bank. On top of all of that, we‚Äôre a media company, our Growth team generate a stream of content that supports our brand and changes the conversation - not necessarily in that order.
To do this we need an amazing team so we have pulled together the best in financial services and beyond.
We truly live our values at 11:FS, and they are critical to your entire journey here. ‚ÄòCultural Add‚Äô is as, if not more, important as pure technical fit, and as part of your interview process we‚Äôll deep dive in our values and your beliefs. Everyone at 11:FS fits our 4 core values: Team, Attitude, Communication and Impact, and this remains at the core of our growth.

 As our People Performance Partner you play a pivotal part in helping us fulfil our mission to unleash talent and cultivate an environment where people can do their very best work. Our aim is to foster a high growth, high impact and high performing culture. We are not a family, we are a winning team, and success in this role will be to act as coach to the business ensuring everyone is in the right position, incentivised in the right way and all of our leaders feel equipped to manage. 
This role will be fundamental in driving 11:FS‚Äôs strategy and growth through a people lens. You will need to tread the fine line between employee wants and needs and balance that with commercial acumen. You will wear many hats across the full employee lifecycle, everything from working closely with our Talent Lead to bring the best people into the business, onboarding, performance management, L&D, community and Values initiatives and positive exits.
This is a powerhouse, standalone role with opportunities to build out the team as we grow the business. You will be joining the CoS team and work collaboratively across the entire Group in everything you do. 
The finer details of the role‚Ä¶

Manage all aspects of the employee life cycle from attract to exit. 
Provide proactive support, coaching, and guidance on all things people related to senior leaders and managers.
Develop and deliver scalable initiatives, policies and embed our rituals and rhythms to supercharge the employee experience, job satisfaction, and morale. 
Lead on complex employee relations cases with empathy and have a focus on upskilling managers in order to mitigate risks and minimise escalations. 
Act as a strategic partner, working closely with senior stakeholders and our FTC Talent Lead to determine future hires and develop robust recruitment plans and strategies.
Ideate, improve and be a key driver in shaping our, Values, Wellbeing and D&I strategy and roadmap.
Ensuring utilisation & data integrity of all people systems. This includes BambooHR, 15Five, CultureAmp, Enboarder, Google Suite, Notion, Greenhouse. 
Proactively identify people issues and trends within the business using HR metrics/KPIs, and work with key stakeholders to formulate solutions.

We‚Äôd like to hear from you if you‚Ä¶

Have 5+ years of generalist HR experience, ideally as a People Partner within a fast-growing, Digital/Technology, FinTech or Start-Up.
Have strong knowledge of UK employment law and best practice and experience with restructure, change and developing HR strategies.
Have previous recruitment experience and comfortable hiring a range of types of roles - we need support for hiring everything from Product to Sales to Tech roles.
Are confident working in a standalone HR role - you will have support from the CoS, Workforce Ops manage and the SLT.
Genuinely care about working with employees, offering empathy, building trust quickly throughout your area of responsibility.
Possess outstanding communication skills, are proactive and adapt to different types of situations with authenticity and a can-do attitude approach.
Can demonstrate analytical, problem solving and decision making skills.
Are organised and have a high attention to detail.
Can work under pressure and meet deadlines while working with ambiguity.
Are results-oriented mindset, not scared by stretch goals.

Benefits

Competitive salary üí∏
25 days annual leave, birthday day off & Christmas shutdown! üìÜ
Top level BUPA health and dental insurance üè•
Work from anywhere 3 months of the year üå¥
Hybrid working üè†üè¢
Annual learning budget üìö
Enhanced parental leave üë∂
Cycle to work scheme üö¥
Top spec MacBook Pro üíª
Regular socials üéâ
 

We strongly encourage people of colour, lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, queer and non-binary people, parents, and individuals with disabilities to apply. 11:FS is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes everyone to our team. If you need reasonable adjustments at any point in the application or interview process, please let us know.

In your application, please feel free to note which pronouns you use (For example - she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

demographic_questions.description:
We’re massively focused on creating a diverse and inclusive workplace and to ensure that we’re tracking in the right direction there are a few questions below that we’d love your help with that will help ensure that we’re treating every application fairly and equally.

All data collected is completely anonymous and has zero attachment or bearing on your application.

questions.label: What best represents your gender identity?
How would you describe your race / ethnicity?

answer_options.label: White, English, Welsh, Scottish, Northern Irish or British
Any other black, African or Caribbean background

questions.label: Which age group do you belong to?
Would you identify yourself as a person with a disability?

questions.description: Unfortunately we are unable to sponsor Visas at this time, but please do check back in with us in the future.
questions.label: Are you eligible to work in the United Kingdom?
Why do you want to work for 11:FS ?
